meanings.definition: of poor quality or taste; tacky or cheap
meanings.sent1: The shlockier movie had terrible acting and a ridiculous plot.
meanings.sent2: The shlockier decorations at the party looked like they were bought at a dollar store.
meanings.sent3: The shlockier costume contest entries made everyone laugh with their creativity.
meanings.sent4: Her taste in fashion was so shlockier that she stood out in a crowd.
meanings.sent5: The shlockier painting in the gallery seemed to clash with the other elegant artworks.

meanings.definition: in a manner that is of even poorer quality or taste
meanings.sent1: She sang shlockier than anyone else at the karaoke night.
meanings.sent2: The artist painted shlockier when rushed to finish the project.
meanings.sent3: He danced shlockier than a penguin trying to tap dance.
meanings.sent4: The comedian's jokes fell shlockier as the night went on.
meanings.sent5: The food tasted even shlockier after being left out for hours.

meanings.definition: something of low quality or taste, often used in reference to entertainment or merchandise
meanings.sent1: The movie was a shlockier than expected, with bad special effects.
meanings.sent2: She bought a shlockier of a souvenir from the tourist shop.
meanings.sent3: The toy looked so shlockier that even the kids didn't want to play with it.
meanings.sent4: The book was a shlockier, with a predictable plot and flat characters.
meanings.sent5: The store was filled with shlockier, from knock-off designer bags to poorly made toys.
